entry.title: Exercise 03
entry.summary:
Instructions

This exercises uses the following data sets that you need to have installed locally:

  • nat.geojsonnj
  • NAT.shp
  • NAT.dbf

Note you can download a zip file with the data here. Once you download the zip file and extract the files they can be found in:

giasp16/content/pages/notebooks/data

You may also want to revisit some of the notebooks from previous sessions to help carry out the following tasks.

Tasks

  1. Using the national shapefile file, construct the following spatial weights matrices:
    • Rook contiguity
    • Queen contiguity
    • knn (k=5)
  2. For the homicide rates in 1970 and 1990 carry out a descriptive statistical analysis that reports
    • Histograms
    • Kernel density of the statistical distributions
    • Summary statistics (mean, median, standard deviation, max, min)
  3. For the same rates create the following choropleth maps
    • Quintiles
    • Quartiles
    • Maximum Breaks
    • HeadsTails
  4. Using the three spatial weights matrices you built, carry out tests for global spatial autocorrelation
    • Join counts (binary based on above/below the median)
    • Moran's I

Be sure to include an interpretation of each of your analyses within the notebook.

Submission

  • Due: 2016-03-17 10:30a.m.
  • Submit your notebook file with the name e03.ipynb on Blackboard. Be sure to document your file to include any notes and your name.

entry.title: Exercise 02
entry.summary:
Instructions

This exercise uses the data sets introduced in class. Make sure you have them stored locally.

  1. For the Mexican income data mexico.csv, find the following for each year:
    1. Wealthiest state (name and value)
    2. Poorest state (name and value)
    3. Average state income (value)
    4. Number of states below the average income each year
  2. For the geojson file nat.json
    1. Determine how many features are in the collection
    2. Find the geometry that has the eastern most point in the collection
    3. Find the geometry that has the western most point in the collection
    4. Find the geometry that has the southern most point in the collection
    5. Find the geometry that has the northern most point in the collection
    6. Find the county that has the highest homicide rate in 1990

Submission

  • Due: 2016-02-18 10:30a.m.
  • Submit your notebook file with the name e02.ipynb on Blackboard. Be sure to document your file to include any notes and your name.

entry.title: Exercise 01
entry.summary:
Instructions

  1. Run through the notebooks 01-06 at Python-Lectures

  2. Create a notebook that does the following

    1. Takes the string Geographic Information Analysisand creates a list of the individual characters in the string
    2. Takes the same string and converts it to a list of words
    3. For the list of words from the previous step use set operations to find the union of characters belonging to the words
    4. For the same list of words use set operations to find the intersection of characters belonging to the words
    5. Using the string from step 1, create a dictionary that has each unique character as they key and the value defined as the number of times the character appears in the string
    6. Write a list comprehension that returns all the odd valued integers between 0 and 100 except those between 40 and 50

Submission

  • Due: 2016-02-04 10:30a.m.
  • Submit your notebook file with the name e01.ipynb on Blackboard. Be sure to document your file to include any notes and your name.
